lead_paragraph: As recently as two weeks ago, residents of the community in central New York voted to keep the official seal, which depicts a wrestling match between a white man and the local American Indian chief.

headline.print_headline: Village, in Shift, Will Change a Logo Called Racist
headline.main: Whitesboro, N.Y., in Reversal, Will Change a Logo Called Racist

snippet: As recently as two weeks ago, residents of the community in central New York voted to keep the official seal, which depicts a wrestling match between a white man and the local American Indian chief.
abstract: Village of Whitesboro, NY, says it will work with Oneida Indian Nation to alter official village seal depicting founding father throttling Native American; emblem survived decades of opposition, and was recently endorsed once again by residents, but failed to survive withering criticism after awareness grew online.
